alert.note: Alert for Estill; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 1:50PM EST until January 03 at 9:18PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Red River at Clay City affecting Powell and Estill Counties. For the Red River...including Clay City...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River at Clay City. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Several roads are impassable in and around Clay City. Some homes are flooded in low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM EST Sunday the stage was 19.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 PM EST Sunday was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage sometime Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.5 feet on 05/08/1984. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The next statement will be issued by 10 PM.
